intro.title: Portfolio
intro.pt1:
Hello, whoever is reading this!

You are on my website.
Specifically on my portfolio website, where I store some of my projects. If you would like to see them all, the link to my social networks is right next door!

If you continued here, I believe you would like to know more about me (and about the most important projects I will present here).
intro.pt2:
Firstly, my name is Bernardo Tameirão, and I am a Computer Science student at USP.

I am a member of the game development group Fellowship of the Game and I am part of a scientific initiation on evolutionary systems.

And I've already done some projects as a hobby, including two other websites that I'll attach to this one as soon as they're ready.

topics.title: USP
topics.text: I'm in the 4th year of my Computer Science degree at the University of São Paulo, the best ranked university in Latin America.

topics.title: FoG
topics.text: I participate in the game development extension group Fellowship of the Game, since the beginning of my course, in which I learned about Unity, C#, and project coordination.

topics.title: Semcomp
topics.text: I participated in the Semcomp organization in 2023 and 2024, as a member of the marketing team.

topics.title: Brazilian Robotics Olympiad: Theoretical Modality
topics.text: I was awarded the gold medal in 2019 and was invited to the robotics workshop, in which only the best from each brazilian state were called.

topics.title: Brazilian Astronomy Olympiad
topics.text: I was awarded the gold medal in 2020 and 2019, and the bronze medal in 2018.

particleLife.text:
One of the projects I did was Particle Life, as the possibility of slightly changing some rules placed, and completely changing a canvas, was very interesting.

So, with some simple rules, such as attraction and repulsion between particles it was possible to create some distinct screens, as can be seen alongside.

evolutionaryRobot.text: I do a scientific research initiation focused on the development of a robotic arm capable of obtaining the best path to a goal using evolutionary systems. A prototype has already been made by me, as shown below.
